description: Highly acclaimed building of red brick with colourful window details and roof, the British Library is the ultimate in post-modernity. The design follows the English Free Style of architecture. RIBA Award Winner.

events.name: BSL workshop: Making a new British Library
events.notes: THIS EVENT IS SOLD OUT.                                            Create your own print-based pop up building inspired by the shapes and textures of the British Library! In this workshop, especially designed for Deaf families, we will explore how different spaces make us feel using print block techniques to create personalised paper buildings. We will add lighting and figures to explore how we change our built environment. This is a fun, interactive workshop for all the family, using print making techniques led by professional artists. BSL interpretation will be provided. If you would like to find out more about this workshop please email familylearning@bl.uk. PLEASE NOTE: This workshop is specifically for Deaf families.

facilities: Family activities during open house festival

factsheet.heading: About
paragraphs: The British Library is the national library of the United Kingdom and is one of the largest libraries in the world. It is estimated to contain between 170 and 200 million items from many countries.

factsheet.heading: Architecture
paragraphs: The new library was designed specially for the purpose by the architect Colin St John Wilson in collaboration with his wife MJ Long, who came up with the plan that was subsequently developed and built. Facing Euston Road is a large piazza that includes pieces of public art, such as large sculptures by Eduardo Paolozzi (a bronze statue based on William Blake's study of Isaac Newton) and Antony Gormley. It is the largest public building constructed in the United Kingdom in the 20th century.

travel_info: Nearest tube: Euston, King's Cross St. Pancras
Nearest train: King's Cross, Euston, St.Pancras

name: British Library
